ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to speak, read, write, and comprehend Russian at an intermediate level. Much of the focus was on aspect and participle building.
I solidified my knowledge of some Russian grammar topics, and expanded my vocabulary a bit.
This course provided further enhancement of all areas in learning this language.
My knowledge and understanding of the Russian language vastly improved.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There are no real weaknesses in this course. The only thing that I would highlight is that you will be learning a lot of content in five weeks. Professor Titus is the biggest strength of the course.
Only weakness was answers not provided online for textbook problems to check answers.
The only criticism I have was that the online format was difficult with the speed of the class, but I know this was unavoidable.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only if the student is serious about learning Russian. If you are taking the course to fulfill the language requirement, I wouldn't recommend it.

Yes, I would definitely recommend any Russian course to any student at Yale. It might seem difficult, but Russian is actually a really fun language to learn, and you forget that it's one of the hardest languages for English speakers to learn pretty quickly, because professor Titus is so fantastic. To anyone that has started learning Russian and is considering continuing with a summer program, do it! I'm assuming it's even better when you actually get to go to Russia, but learning over the summer is a great way to not forget everything by the fall semester.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student!

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
